alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Guernsey; Harrison; Muskingum; Tuscarawas (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT WESTERN HARRISON...GUERNSEY... EASTERN MUSKINGUM...SOUTHERN CARROLL AND SOUTHEASTERN TUSCARAWAS COUNTIES THROUGH 230 PM EDT... At 200 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Uhrichsville to New Concord. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cambridge, Uhrichsville, Freeport, Dennison, New Concord, Byesville, Gnadenhutten, Antrim, Tuscarawas, Scio, Midvale, and Bowerston. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Ohio between mile markers 170 and 195. Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 42 and 64. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
